Hot Rod.Action: Lopes up hill after Daniel and encourages him to 'ride in style', scoops him onto hoverboard and rides together over hill.
Sits bored with fishing rod and dismisses it as dull, then tosses the rod into the water.
Looks bored and tosses fishing rod into water, showing disinterest and lack of engagement.
Quickly lopes up hill after Daniel and encourages riding 'in style,' then transforms and rides over hill with Daniel in front seat, demonstrating agility, confidence, and skill.
Rides recklessly with Daniel beyond city limits despite warnings, barrels through a stop sign, almost knocking over Kup.
Invites Daniel to use binoculars to see the view, shares excitement about the lookout point.
Disregards safety rules and drives recklessly beyond city limits, nearly knocking over Kup.
Uses enhanced vision to spot the hole in the shuttle and identify enemy presence (Starscream and Constructicons).
Fires on the shuttle to attack Decepticons, explicitly states 'This is for Ironhide.'
Pulls Daniel to safety and encourages him with 'Hang on!'
Draws his gun quickly and starts firing on the shuttle to attack Decepticons.
Pulls Daniel back to protect him from Megatron's blast and the collapsing viewing platform.
Kicks at Hook and Scavenger, causing them to crash and triggering a landslide, then skillfully 'rides' the landslide down the slope, evading pursuit.
Acts furiously and impulsively, firing and revealing their position, which Megatron calls an imbecilic mistake.
Covers Daniel with his arms while tumbling down the slope, trying to slow the fall
Interrupts Kup's warning with 'Save it'
Covers Daniel with his arms while tumbling down the slope, trying unsuccessfully to slow their fall.
Arrives safely at the bottom after tumbling down a mountain slope pursued by enemies.
Races toward Autobot City with Kup, transforming into vehicle mode amidst enemy fire, showing focus under pressure.
Interrupts Kup when Kup tries to lecture him about cockiness and insubordination.
Refuses to explain security violation, showing defiance and disrespect to Ultra Magnus's authority.
Follows Kup when urged roughly to do so, indicating some level of cooperation despite earlier defiance.
Joins others in pushing the huge Catapult into firing position, works cooperatively with team.
Responds to Arcee's concern with confidence and lightheartedness, showing friendly rapport.
Joins others in pushing the huge Catapult into firing position, working cooperatively and persistently.
Claims he wasn't worried about being trapped outside the city walls, trying to remain cool and collected.
Fighting alongside others, trying to save Optimus Prime by charging into battle.
Ignoring Kup's advice to stay away; rushing into a dangerous situation prematurely.
Dispatches a Decepticon, encourages Optimus Prime with a supportive remark ('That's showing him, Optimus!')
Leaps out to grapple Megatron to prevent him from grabbing a gun despite Optimus Prime's warning to move aside
Runs over to the fallen Optimus Prime and says 'Optimus! Forgive me!'
Leaps out to grapple Megatron, showing initiative in combat.
Attempts to grab the Blaster but is quickly subdued and used as a shield by Megatron.
Runs over to the wounded Optimus Prime and expresses regret, showing concern but no immediate effective action.
Encourages optimism by affirming the Matrix can stop the menace, shows willingness to face the danger.
Responds to Ultra Magnus with a hopeful and supportive attitude instead of panic.
Does not show hesitation or self-centeredness in the face of the threat, but focuses on the group goal.
Tells Arcee to stay close to him, showing concern for her safety.
Tries to protect Arcee by telling her to stay close and attempts to shield himself from incoming laser fire.
Allows Arcee to pull him out of harm's way rather than expertly dodging the laser himself.
Practices sparring with a high-tech auto-combatant, demonstrating focus and skill training.
Interrupts storytelling to emphasize urgency about survival, shows frustration yet continues to engage in sparring with a playful competitor.
Engages cooperatively with Kup, openly acknowledges Kup's successful idea.
Shows wide-eyed attention and trust in Kup's experience and judgment.
Still cartwheeling down toward the planet below, trying to change the angle of his fall
Calls out to Kup and Grimlock for help after falling into the sea, showing concern for friends.
Attempts to fight the Robotoid squid attacking Kup, tries to protect his friend.
Tells the squid 'Don't worry, I'm not coming after you,' demonstrating a non-aggressive, reassuring attitude.
Urgently helps Kup by clearing sand and reassembling his scattered body parts, responding immediately to Kup's request for help.
Shows concern and attentiveness by asking Kup to say something and checking his functionality after repairs.
Displays honesty and a helpful attitude when admitting uncertainty about a missing part and examining scrap metals carefully.
Rapidly pulls Kup's scattered body parts together and attempts to reassemble him skillfully.
Confidently analyzes and identifies unfamiliar parts among the scrap metal, distinguishing between Kup's parts and others.
Denies the possibility that a piece is missing despite Kup's clear indication.
Successfully helps Kup repair himself and even improves a part, showing technical skill.
Fails to fully notice or address that a part is still missing, leading to imperfect repair.
Mocks Kup by mimicking the Universal Greeting.
Hesitates and is somewhat suspicious during the greeting process to the Sharkticons.
Expresses concern about the expense of giving Energon cubes to the Sharkticons.
Mocking and mimicking the Universal Greeting, but participates cautiously in giving Energon cubes despite suspicion.
Questions the effectiveness of their tactic when the Sharkticons do not reciprocate as expected.
Falls backwards along with Kup, taken by surprise when the Sharkticons suddenly attack.
Makes a sarcastic joke about needing a new travel agent despite their dire situation
Expresses concern and confusion about their predicament
Comments on their predicament with some humor despite the danger, recognizing their inability to transform due to restraining bolts.
Shows impatience or frustration by dismissing experienced advice from Kup with a sarcastic remark.
Engages alongside Kup in fighting Sharkticons, participates cooperatively and with humor ('Wish you'd figured that out a little sooner.', 'Didn't even bend a fender.')
Expresses relief and friendliness toward the Dinobots by calling them 'big bozos' in a good-natured way
Shows concern about their own situation after the battle by asking about needing a ship
Fights alongside Kup shooting at Sharkticons, but soon overrun.
Digs himself out of the pile of Sharkticon parts, showing resilience.
Expresses relief at arrival of Dinobots, showing awareness of allies but no direct action.
Acknowledges ongoing problems and need for a ship, demonstrating situational awareness and concern for mission needs.
Asks who Wheelie is and immediately claims him as a friend if he can find a ship, showing openness and acceptance toward a new, feral robot.
Waves to Daniel and his friends on the ground, showing recognition and reassurance.
Returns in cruiser with Kup and Dinobots coming to help.
Returns flying a cruiser and approaches a dangerous situation to check on friends.
Shows no hesitation or panic when encountering hostile Junkions.
Steps out with big smile and offers energon sticks.
Gently pushes Kup's rifle aside saying 'Guns aren't exactly friendly.'
Steps out confidently with a big smile and energon sticks, disarms a tense situation by gently pushing Kup's rifle aside and suggesting that guns aren't friendly.
Initiates warm interaction by attempting universal greeting, smiling, sharing energon sticks to celebrate with Junkions, encourages dancing and communal joy.
Successfully recalls and uses the Universal greeting to defuse a potentially tense situation with Wreck-Gar and the Junkions, prompting positive reactions and camaraderie.
Gently pushes aside Kup's rifle to suggest a non-violent approach, showing confidence and skill in social interaction.
Looks at Wreck-Gar and the Junkions strangely and asks where they learned to talk like that.
Expresses optimistic belief in the Matrix despite Ultra Magnus saying it's gone
Encourages trust in themselves and determination to destroy Unicron even against odds
Inspires hope and confidence despite loss of the matrix, urging trust in themselves to defeat Unicron.
Conveys determination and leadership in a desperate situation by motivating others.
Expresses disbelief and awe together with companions, invites shared reflection on the scene they witness.
Uses intercom to call for battle stations, organizing others in a cooperative effort against a threat.
Approaches Galvatron fearlessly to protect the Autobot Matrix despite the danger.
Engages courageously against a powerful enemy to defend his allies.
Jumps out to confront Galvatron, physically attacks him despite the obvious danger.
Transforms and attempts to escape after initial attack when Galvatron retaliates.
Jumps out suddenly and attacks Galvatron, landing a solid punch.
Transforms strategically between car and humanoid mode to evade and counterattack Galvatron.
Chooses to retreat to avoid direct confrontation with Galvatron rather than recklessly fighting to the end.
Struggles valiantly against Galvatron despite being overpowered and nearly strangled to death.
Clutches the Matrix to transform and rise to newfound strength and wisdom, showing perseverance and hope.
Declares 'This is the end of the road, Galvatron.' before decisively defeating his enemy, demonstrating courage and a protective nature.
Sticks his hand in the matrix without hesitation and successfully unleashes a powerful attack that causes massive damage to Unicron.
Encourages optimism by saying 'They're our way in! Yaaaaaaay-hah!'
Speeds up past Kup and uses an enemy (Kickback) to gain advantage and help the group advance
Refuses to explain his security violation, showing confidence and defiance.
Immediately mans his battle station when ordered, displaying readiness to engage.
Is grabbed and crushed by Devastator but is subsequently released during the Dinobots' struggle against Devastator.
Nods and quickly passes his hand over bank of switches all of which glow and pulse with action, engaging boosters as ordered.
Nods and quickly passes his hand over bank of switches all of which glow and pulse with the action, showing understanding and control of complex machinery.
Encourages others by saying 'You got 'em!' during tense moments under fire, displaying confidence and motivational awareness.
No indication of hesitation or mistake under Decepticon fire, managing shuttle controls during launch.
Sparring with a highly advanced Auto-Combatant using a laser dagger and shield, demonstrating practice and skill development.
Interrupts Kup's story to emphasize urgency about survival, showing situational awareness and prioritization.
Thrown off and struck multiple times by the Auto-Combatant, suggesting vulnerability or lack of experience in combat.
Rises and prepares to retaliate after being attacked, showing resilience and fighting spirit.
Pilots the Dinobot shuttle with Kup during a high-pressure missile pursuit, indicating capability and courage under pressure.
Quickly notices the incoming claw and commands to dive, showing situational awareness and timely reaction.
Acknowledges Kup's unorthodox maneuver (inversing polarities) with initial concern but accepts its effectiveness.
Watches wide-eyed and appears somewhat passive while Kup pilots and solves the problem, showing some lack of active engagement or leadership.
Fails to evade the attacking claw resulting in the destruction of the ship and his presumed death.
Flips around twice in mid-air then regains his feet and leans on Arcee for support; receives praise from Arcee for a good first performance.
Questions Wheelie about his identity and assesses his usefulness in finding a Quintesson ship, showing curiosity and resourcefulness.
Expresses disbelief at Wheelie's identified ship, asking 'That's a ship?'
Drives the Cruiser boldly toward Unicron despite the danger.
Engages in formation flight with the Junkion ship and Dinobots, showing coordinated tactical movement.
No hesitation or retreat when Unicron lashes out with fire and physical force, maintaining steady approach.
Survives being tossed like rubbish and tumbles down a deep pit inside Unicron's head, showing resilience and continued presence in a critical situation.
No direct actions are described that display active problem-solving or leadership at this point; simply falling and being out of immediate control.
Tries to race away from Galvatron but is caught and nearly strangled, struggling against a stronger opponent.
Despite being nearly dead, manages to grasp the Matrix hanging from Galvatron's chest, triggering a transformative power-up.
After transformation into Rodimus Prime, confidently declares defeat to Galvatron and physically overpowers him.
Transforms into Rodimus Prime and leads the Autobots by swiftly arriving to rescue and then commands transformation and attack.
Takes on leadership and instills hope with confident statements about a new age of peace.
